title: Renewal of the mandate of the Algerian candidate to the ACHPR
text: The candidate of Algeria, the Magistrate Bensaoula Chafika, was re-elected, Thursday, member of the African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights for a second term (2024-2030), during the 42nd session of the Executive Council of the African Union (AU), held at the AU headquarters in Addis Ababa (Ethiopia).
The election of Dr. Bensaoula Chafika comes after Algeria has extended its candidacy for a second term as a judge at the African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights.

At the closure of the vote, the candidate of Algeria obtained the majority of votes (38) on the 41 voting states, reflecting the great recognition enjoyed by Algeria under the leadership of President of the Republic, Mr. Abdelmadjid Tebboune in the protection and promotion of human rights and peoples on the continent, in addition to its tireless efforts to raise the values and principles enshrined in the Constitutive Act of the AU to serve the interests of the peoples of the continent.
The African Court is composed of 11 judges from AU member countries, elected by the Executive Council composed of Ministries of Foreign Affairs.
